name: Matthew Paris Map of Britain (c.1250)
description: One of four surviving maps by Matthew Paris, monk and historian at St Albans Abbey. A medieval gazetteer of 13th-century England, Wales and Scotland. Shows 'Mamecestre'.
notes:
British Library Cotton MS Claudius D VI, f. 12v.
Originally part of Paris's Abbreviatio Chronicorum (1250s).
Now bound separately. Oriented with north at top (unusual for medieval maps).
Annotated interactive version: https://mdr-maa.org/resource/matthew-pariss-clickable-map-an-interactive-claudius-map/
BL Digitised Manuscripts: search 'Cotton MS Claudius D VI'.
